title: 2-year-old girl accidentally shot in cheek as uncle cleans gun
content:
Updated 5:04 p.m.: This post has been updated to correct and identify the relative who accidentally shot the 2-year-old girl.
A 2-year-old girl was accidentally shot in the cheek Friday, according to an officer with the Colton Fire District.
Her uncle, identified as 24-year-old Luke Andrew Bowman, was cleaning his gun when it went off, according to the Clackamas County Sheriff's Office spokesman Sgt. Nathan Thompson. Bowman lives at the residence located in the 30700 block of South Marian Street near Molalla.
The girl, who has not been identified, was taken by LifeFlight helicopter to OHSU Hospital. Doug Colney of the Colton Fire District said her injuries do not appear to be life-threatening.
Officers from the Clackamas County Sheriff's Office and crews from the Colton and Molalla Fire District responded. The investigation is continuing, Colney said.
Criminal charges have not been filed, and the family is cooperating with detectives, Thompson said.
The Oregonian's Nuran Alteir contributed to this report.
